data.title: Extensions not instlling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch VS Code
2. Install extension (C/C++, Csharp, Python) using 'ext install ...'

The extensions never get installed; the busy icon in the bottom left shimmers indefinitely.

I've uninstalled, re-installed, installed and ran as Administrator. I've deleted the .vscode\extensions directory.

My other Win 10 Pro computer, same network, runs VSCode fine and installs extensions fine. Same user, same domain, same build of Win10. Copying the contents of the extensions directory to the non-working system seems to work.

data.title: integrated terminal doesn't redraw correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0 - Insider
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Resize the terminal to be very narrow so that some text gets cut off
2. Resize it back to normal size
3. See that the text is either still cut off or drawn in a weird way

notice how "All rights reserved" is not redrawn
![a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615558/15784997/b43e3768-297a-11e6-9293-2ceaa827ac71.png)
![b](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615558/15784996/b4382ab2-297a-11e6-87fd-fad43f1229ec.png)
![c](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6615558/15784998/b4482f34-297a-11e6-8297-d9926aa638b7.png)

add keybinding focus at integrated terminal

data.title: Open editors list lost middle click to close file (fixes #7162)
Partial tree refresh breaks tree structure
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Comment out following line https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/views/openEditorsView.ts#L173
2. Build from source, have two editors open side by side, and drag editors in the open editors view
3. Notice tree gets broken, children of an open editor become it's siblings

I verified that the getId and getChildren calls on the open editors side look good
I believe this is happening because I am doing a partial tree refresh. If I do a full tree refresh all is good - thus the workaround

data.title: Problem with changing languages
data.body: - VSCode Version:Version 1.1.1 (1.1.1) - OS Version: Mac Os x 10.11.5 (15F34) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Put html text and set the language to HTML 2. Type Javascript in the html file 3. Switch the language to JavaScript Red lines and dots occur, switching back to HTML doesnt not fix the problem.

data.title: propose command ids in keybindings.json
data.body: When authoring keybindings, we should propose command ids using intellisense

data.title: editor.insertSpaces and editor.tabSize changes don't apply for JSON files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise 64 bit 

User settings editor.insertSpaces and editor.tabSize don't seem to change the behaviour for .json files.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Generate or create a package.json file
2. Open Visual Studio
3. Go to File > Preferences > User Settings
4. Add "editor.insertSpaces": false to the JSON file and "editor.tabSize": 4
5. Go to the package.json file and use tab

data.title: Search results navigation in Tree using keyboard is not consistent as using mouse
data.body:
Navigation in search results is as follows:

Using Mouse
- clicking with the mouse keeps focus in the tree
- double click moves focus to the editor
- Cmd/Ctrl+click opens the editor to the side

Using Keyboard
- There is no way to do what mouse single click is doing
- There is no way to do what Cmd/Ctrl+click is doing

data.title: Refresh explorer view after loading all package.json of extensions.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Make sure that the operation of open editor is done after the package.json of extensions is loaded. This can allows all of the editors and inputs can use the mimetypes defines in extensions.

data.title: Expose bracket matching functionality to extensions
data.body:
I'm developing a Vim extension for Visual Studio Code and I could really use your guys' bracket matching  logic. 

Either exposing a function like `getTextDecorations()` or, better yet, a function like `getMatchingBracket(position: Position)` would be awesome.

Thanks!

data.title: Adopt more typed events
data.body: We do have many events as untyped global ones that we should convert to typed events (in untitled and files land).

data.title: Code format shortcut is not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Focus the text editor
2. Modify some code, so that code is not properly formatted;
3. Try the shortcut shift+alt+F;

Code is not formatted.

Other shortcuts are working (I don't know if any of them, but ctrl+F works)

data.title: put marker filter into panel header
data.body: Instead of having a toggle button that reveal the filter widget we should just move into the panel header. That would make it not take extra space and still be easily discoverable.

data.title: marker list should toggle when pressing the status bar again
data.body:
- press marker indication in status bar
- marker list shows
- press marker indication again
-  the list should hide

data.title: Stop this extensions syndrome for UserVoice requests... it's irritating!
data.body:
When people request a feature or language support they expect official support for it! not a 3rd-party extension that barely work!

Now, extensions really exist for 3rd-parties to extend the editor but I really think you need to have some standards to determine whether extensions are of reasonable quality to mark the items as _completed_ at UserVoice!

Just as an example when people download a language extension they really expect everything to just work! they really expect to have at least an intellisense and a working debugger.

Now, I'm not here to tell you how to do things I'm just raising a concern!

data.title: Sometimes extension host zombie stays around
data.body: I often happens to me that I have a zombie extension host somewhere. Unsure how that happens but I think it should self terminate when its parent PID isn't there anymore.

data.title: switch desktop will type letter 'E' auto
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.0 insider
- OS Version:windows 10 insider preview 14352

bug report
if you open vscode writing c++ code, then press ctrl+win+left to switch desktop(multi-desktop mode),and when you switch back, the editor will type an 'E' automactically without any other operation.

data.title: Why does editor.lineHeight default to 0?
data.body:
`editor.lineHeight` has it's default set to 0 here https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/common/config/defaultConfig.ts#L99

Should it actually be `GOLDEN_LINE_HEIGHT_RATIO` or `null` instead? https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/common/config/defaultConfig.ts#L30

It's a little confusing seeing this, since 0 means the lines will be stacked on each other:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/15766804/85a9bee6-28f7-11e6-9291-84fc04c79469.png)
